info.title: Product Variant
info.description:
Important

Apps can no longer set inventory using inventory_quantity or inventory_quantity_adjustment. For more information, refer to the Inventory Level resource.

A variant can be added to a Product resource to represent one version of a product with several options. The Product resource will have a variant for every possible combination of its options. Each product can have a maximum of three options and a maximum of 100 variants.

paths.description: Retrieves a list of product variants. Note: As of version 2019-10, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Make paginated requests to the REST Admin API.
paths.summary: Retrieves a list of product variants

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Return up to this many results per page

parameters.name: presentment_currencies
parameters.description: Return presentment prices in only certain currencies, specified by a comma-separated list of ISO 4217 currency codes.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID

200.description: Retrieves a list of product variants

x-examples.name: Retrieve all variants for a product

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/variants.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Variant.all(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve all variants for a product after a specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/variants.json?since_id=49148385" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Variant.all(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
  since_id: "49148385",
)

x-examples.name: Retrieve all variants for a product with prices in specified presentment currencies

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/variants.json?presentment_currencies=USD%2CCAD" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Variant.all(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
  presentment_currencies: "USD,CAD",
)

curl -d '{"variant":{"option1":"Yellow","price":"1.00"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/variants.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

variant = ShopifyAPI::Variant.new(session: test_session)
variant.product_id = 632910392
variant.option1 = "Yellow"
variant.price = "1.00"
variant.save!

x-examples.name: Create a new product variant with a metafield

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"variant":{"option1":"Blue","metafields":[{"key":"new","value":"newvalue","type":"single_line_text_field","namespace":"global"}]}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/variants.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

variant = ShopifyAPI::Variant.new(session: test_session)
variant.product_id = 632910392
variant.option1 = "Blue"
variant.metafields = [
  {
    "key" => "new",
    "value" => "newvalue",
    "type" => "single_line_text_field",
    "namespace" => "global"
  }
]
variant.save!

x-examples.name: Create a new product variant with an image

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"variant":{"image_id":850703190,"option1":"Purple"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/variants.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

variant = ShopifyAPI::Variant.new(session: test_session)
variant.product_id = 632910392
variant.image_id = 850703190
variant.option1 = "Purple"
variant.save!

paths.description: Retrieves a count of product variants
paths.summary: Receive a count of all Product Variants

200.description: Receive a count of all Product Variants

x-examples.name: Retrieve a count all variants for a product

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/variants/count.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Variant.count(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
)

paths.description: Retrieves a single product variant by ID

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response

x-examples.name: Retrieve a product variant by ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/variants/808950810.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Variant.find(
  session: test_session,
  id: 808950810,
)

x-examples.name: Add a metafield to an existing variant

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"variant":{"id":808950810,"metafields":[{"key":"new","value":"newvalue","type":"single_line_text_field","namespace":"global"}]}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/variants/808950810.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

variant = ShopifyAPI::Variant.new(session: test_session)
variant.id = 808950810
variant.metafields = [
  {
    "key" => "new",
    "value" => "newvalue",
    "type" => "single_line_text_field",
    "namespace" => "global"
  }
]
variant.save!

x-examples.name: Add an existing image to an existing variant

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"variant":{"id":808950810,"image_id":562641783}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/variants/808950810.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

variant = ShopifyAPI::Variant.new(session: test_session)
variant.id = 808950810
variant.image_id = 562641783
variant.save!

x-examples.name: Update the title and price of an existing variant

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"variant":{"id":808950810,"option1":"Not Pink","price":"99.00"}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/variants/808950810.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

variant = ShopifyAPI::Variant.new(session: test_session)
variant.id = 808950810
variant.option1 = "Not Pink"
variant.price = "99.00"
variant.save!

curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-10/products/632910392/variants/808950810.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
)

ShopifyAPI::Variant.delete(
  session: test_session,
  product_id: 632910392,
  id: 808950810,
)

properties.description: The barcode, UPC, or ISBN number for the product.
properties.name: barcode

properties.description: The original price of the item before an adjustment or a sale.
properties.name: compare_at_price

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601 format) when the product variant was created.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: The fulfillment service associated with the product variant. Valid values: manual or the handle of a fulfillment service. Multi-managed inventory introduced a breaking change to this field. Fulfillment services will all be opted into SKU sharing in 2023-04. This field is due to be deprecated and will no longer be supported. Please refer to InventoryLevel to see how variants are associated to multiple fulfillment services.
properties.name: fulfillment_service

properties.description: The weight of the product variant in grams.
properties.name: grams

properties.description: The unique numeric identifier for the product variant.
properties.name: id

properties.description:
The unique numeric identifier for a product's image.
          The image must be associated to the same product as the variant.
properties.name: image_id

properties.description: The unique identifier for the inventory item, which is used in the Inventory API to query for inventory information.
properties.name: inventory_item_id

properties.description:
The fulfillment service that tracks the number of items in stock for the product variant. Valid values:
  • shopify: You are tracking inventory yourself using the admin.
  • null: You aren't tracking inventory on the variant.
  • the handle of a fulfillment service that has inventory management enabled: This must be the same fulfillment service referenced by the fulfillment_service property.
properties.name: inventory_management

properties.description:
Whether customers are allowed to place an order for the product variant when it's out of stock. Valid values:

  • deny: Customers are not allowed to place orders for the product variant if it's out of stock.
  • continue: Customers are allowed to place orders for the product variant if it's out of stock.
Default value: deny.
properties.name: inventory_policy

properties.description: An aggregate of inventory across all locations. To adjust inventory at a specific location, use the InventoryLevel resource.
properties.name: inventory_quantity

properties.description: This property is deprecated. Use the InventoryLevel resource instead.
properties.name: old_inventory_quantity

properties.description: This property is deprecated. Use the InventoryLevel resource instead.
properties.name: inventory_quantity_adjustment

properties.description: The custom properties that a shop owner uses to define product variants. You can define three options for a product variant: option1, option2, option3. Default value: Default Title. The title field is a concatenation of the option1, option2, and option3 fields. Updating the option fields updates the title field.
properties.name: option

properties.description:
A list of the variant's presentment prices and compare-at prices in each of the shop's enabled presentment currencies. Each price object has the following properties:
  • currency_code: The three-letter code (ISO 4217 format) for one of the shop's enabled presentment currencies.
  • amount: The variant's price or compare-at price in the presentment currency.
Requires the header 'X-Shopify-Api-Features': 'include-presentment-prices'.
properties.name: presentment_prices

properties.description: The order of the product variant in the list of product variants. The first position in the list is 1. The position of variants is indicated by the order in which they are listed.
properties.name: position

properties.description: The price of the product variant.
properties.name: price

properties.description: The unique numeric identifier for the product.
properties.name: product_id

properties.description: This property is deprecated. Use the `requires_shipping` property on the InventoryItem resource instead.
properties.name: requires_shipping

properties.description: A unique identifier for the product variant in the shop. Required in order to connect to a FulfillmentService.
properties.name: sku

properties.description: Whether a tax is charged when the product variant is sold.
properties.name: taxable

properties.description: This parameter applies only to the stores that have the Avalara AvaTax app installed. Specifies the Avalara tax code for the product variant.
properties.name: tax_code

properties.description: The title of the product variant. The title field is a concatenation of the option1, option2, and option3 fields. You can only update title indirectly using the option fields.
properties.name: title

properties.description: The date and time when the product variant was last modified. Gets returned in ISO 8601 format.
properties.name: updated_at

properties.description: The weight of the product variant in the unit system specified with weight_unit.
properties.name: weight

properties.description: The unit of measurement that applies to the product variant's weight. If you don't specify a value for weight_unit, then the shop's default unit of measurement is applied. Valid values: g, kg, oz, and lb.
properties.name: weight_unit

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Add or update a product's  variants. Variants are the different combinations of the product's options. For  example, a t-shirt product with size and color options might have a variant in a small size and blue color.
